name: Interface naming convention - prefix
description:
Interfaces should always begin with the prefix as defined in the naming convention.
This reports shows all the Interfaces not starting with the defined prefix.

The prefix is a parameter and can be changed at will.
Prefix for ABAP : IF_ 
Prefix for VB .Net Technology I 
Prefix for C# Technology I 
Prefix for C++ Technology I

Interfaces in C++ are defined as Classes that have at least one Pure Virtual method.
The prefix for C++ is set to I
output:
This report lists all Interfaces that does not respect the naming conventions.
It provides the following information:
Interface full name
rationale: For readability aspects, naming conventions must be respected.
reference:
help.sap.com
Naming Conventions in ABAP Objects
VB: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/0b283bse.aspx
remediation: Change name according to the naming convention.
